item.title: Beogram 4002 (5523): Restoration of the Worn Keypad
item.description:
The Beogram 4002 Type 5523 I’m currently working on, like many others, required keypad restoration due to a common issue of a worn-out start key. The keypad’s condition upon arrival is shown in the first image. The second picture showcases the keypad’s appearance after restoration. To avoid damaging the keypad coating through contact with finger oils and friction, we suggest using a soft cloth for operation, regardless of whether it’s restored or original...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5523-restoration-of-the-worn-keypad/

item.title: Beogram 4000: A New Arrival From New York
item.description:
A Beogram 4000 turntable recently purchased on eBay was shipped using a specialized container to protect it in transit. Thankfully, the seller mostly followed the provided packing guidelines, resulting in no damage during shipping. Upon opening, the turntable was in good condition, with only minor issues. While the blue tape used on the aluminum surfaces didn’t cause any damage to the lettering, there were a few scratches on the platter. These were likely caused by attempts to remove it improperly...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-a-new-arrival-from-new-york/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): Installation of New DIN5 Plug with Gold Plated Pins
item.description:
A gold-plated plug is the finishing touch for a fully restored signal path. Here’s the process on a Beogram 4002(5513) I’m currently working on: Above is the original plug in rough shape due to oxidation. The new Rean plug offers a neat and tidy internal layout. Placing the metal enclosure back results in an even more visually appealing look. That’s the Beolove!..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5513-installation-of-new-din5-plug-with-gold-plated-pins/
